intro: Melampyrum sylvaticum subsp. aestivale, commonly known as summer touch-me-not, is a herbaceous plant belonging to the family Orobanchaceae. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in open woodlands and meadows, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are opposite and lanceolate, often with a slightly hairy surface. This subspecies is distinguished by its flowering time and habitat preferences compared to other subspecies of Melampyrum sylvaticum.
